description: Participate in online forums by posting questions and answers related to lecture modules. Students must submit 2 questions and 2 answers per module, monitored by educators for feedback and engagement.

Read and review a recent popular science book relevant to animal behaviour. Submit a critique evaluating its relevance to societal, biological, and human contexts, with a focus on science communication.
Two-part assessment: Part A involves reviewing a published research article from expert case studies (400 words). Part B includes answering quiz questions from field lecture videos.
Analyse animal behaviour in a nature documentary (Part 1) and review scientific research behind depicted concepts (Part 2). Evaluate science communication strategies and accuracy in media.
